public class zeta.format.impl.FormatState

(source file: impl/FormatState.java)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.format.impl.FormatState
The pure class interface. 
public class FormatState
A class which realizes a state-oriented frontend to the formatting facilities.

Author:
Wolfgang Grieskamp
Version: $Id: FormatState.java,v 1.1.1.1 1998/09/01 10:51:16 wg Exp $

FormatState()
Construct a new format state.

add(Format)
Append a format to format state.
beg(int)
Begin a new nested block.
brk()
Append a line break to the format state.
end()
End a nested block.
lit(String)
Append a literal to the format state.
print(PrintWriter, int)
Output format in state to a PrintWriter.
spc(int)
Append a space to the format state.
spc()
Append a space to the format state.
toFormat()
Return format in state.

FormatState
public FormatState();
Construct a new format state.

add
public void add(Format fmt);
Append a format to format state.

lit

public void lit(String lit);
Append a literal to the format state.

brk

public void brk();
Append a line break to the format state.

spc

public void spc();
Append a space to the format state.

spc

public void spc(int count);
Append a space to the format state.

beg

public void beg(int indent);
Begin a new nested block.

end

public void end();
End a nested block.

toFormat

public Format toFormat();
Return format in state.

print

public void print(PrintWriter writer,
                  int width);
Output format in state to a PrintWriter.
